citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Protected Lands for the Conterminous United States

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This dataset shows the percentage of Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD) 12-digit Hydrologic Unit (HUC) that is included in the USGS National Gap Analysis Program (GAP) or International Union for the Conservation of Nature (IUCN) protection categories in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PADUS). Percentages for GAP status codes 1, 2, and 3, as well as status 1 and 2 combined are provided. The percentages for IUCN categories Ia, Ib, II, III, IV, V, and VI are provided, as well as for all the categories combined. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: This dataset is useful for evaluating measures of sustainability. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.
descript.supplinf:
This EnviroAtlas dataset is based on data originally developed using a version of the Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD 2011) extracted for EnviroAtlas on March 22, 2011. In 2015, EnviroAtlas transitioned from the WBD 2011 to a newer version - the National Hydrography Dataset Plus (NHDPlus) V2 WBD Snapshot, EnviroAtlas version - which includes updated 12-digit HUC boundaries for the Conterminous United States.
This EnviroAtlas dataset was created by reallocating the original WBD 2011 dataset to the NHDPlus V2 WBD Snapshot using area-weighted reallocation. The area weighting process assumes that values are distributed evenly across HUCs. In cases where values are unevenly distributed within a HUC, this can result in misallocated values in the new dataset. Therefore, users should exercise caution when interpreting this data, especially in regions where there are significant changes to the 12-digit HUCs. The majority of spatial changes between the two 12-digit HUC versions took place along the California coast, in Minnesota, and along the US-Canada border, especially in New England. Metric values for most of the rest of the United States are essentially unchanged. If the user is interested in data for a specific small area, especially in areas that were modified, using the original WBD 2011 version of this dataset joined with the WBD 2011 boundary feature class should provide accurate metric values. As new versions of the dataset are developed using the 2015 HUCs, these will replace the reallocated datasets in EnviroAtlas.
Before reallocating the metrics, edits were made to the area of some 12-digit HUCs. For example, along the coast of California some 12-digit HUCs had stopped at the coastline in the WBD 2011 dataset but were extended into the ocean in the NHDPlus V2 dataset. Instead of reallocating the metrics using the total area of the NHDPlus V2 HUCs, the land area based on National Land Cover Database (NLCD) 2011 was used to update the land area values. This ensured the land area of the NHDPlus V2 HUCs roughly matched the land area of the WBD 2011 HUCs. This method helped avoid incorrectly distributing terrestrial metrics, such as including the new ocean-extended area in the denominator of values that were originally calculated using land-only area as the denominator, which would result in artificially lowering the values of per-unit area metrics in the ocean-extended HUCs.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: Obtained National Watershed Boundary Dataset - 22 Mar 2011 version
Projected WBD into Albers and separated it into 2-digit hydrologic unit areas
Obtained GAP version 1.2 of the Protected Areas Database of the United States
Created new field in attribute table to store protection status codes as numbers: one field for GAP Status, one field for IUCN category
For each 2-digit WBD hydrologic unit region, created separate shapefiles of the intersecting PADUS polygons

For each 2-digit WBD hydrologic unit region, created 2 separate grids with a 15 m cell resolution and an extent equal to the corresponding 2-digit NLCD grid. Grid one retained the value of the GAP status numeric field. Grid two retained the value of the IUCN category numeric field.
For each new grid, assigned no data areas a value of '0'
Used ArcView extension, ATtILA 2008 beta, to calculate percentage of each protection category within the hydrologic unit using the Landscape Characteristics dialog and a custom coding scheme
Renamed output fields to corresponding protection status descriptions
Reallocated values from the original March 22 2011 WBD to the NHDPlus V2 WBD Snapshot, EnviroAtlas version for the Conterminous United States using area-weighted redistribution.

enttyp.enttypd: Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is included in the GAP or IUCN protection categories in the Protected Areas Database of the United States.

attr.attrdef: Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category Ia in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category II in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category III in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category IV in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category V in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category VI in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified as IUCN category Ib in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified with GAP status 1 or 2 in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit with IUCN classified areas in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.

Twelve Digit Hydrologic Unit Code. This field provides a unique 12-digit code for each subwatershed. Numbers were assigned in an upstream to downstream fashion. Where no downstream/upstream relationship could be determined, numbers were assigned in a clockwise fashion.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Guidelines, Requirements, and Procedures for the National Watershed Boundary Dataset; Chapter 3 of Section A; Federal Standards, Book 11, Collection and Delineation of Spatial Data; Techniques and Methods 11-A3.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Perimeter of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified with GAP status 1, 2, or 3 in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.
Percentage of WBD 12-digit Hydrologic Unit that is classified with GAP status 3 in the Protected Areas Database of the United States (PAD-US) version 1.2 created by USGS GAP.

overview.eaover:
The metric was generated using the ATtILA tool (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/attila-toolbox), an ArcView tool for calculating commonly used landscape metrics, in conjunction with the GAP version 1.2 of the Protected Areas Database of the United States (for metadata, see http://www.gap.uidaho.edu/padus/PADUS1_2_metadata_html.html; for information on GAP, see http://gapanalysis.usgs.gov/padus/). For more information on the metric calculation, please see the ATtILA User's Manual (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/attila-toolboxpdf/user_guide.pdf).
A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
